meanings.definition: In an irritable or easily angered manner.
meanings.sent1: She responded irascibly to the criticism, snapping at everyone around her.
meanings.sent2: He always speaks irascibly when he is tired and stressed.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed irascibly when it didn't get its favorite treat.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered irascibly, ready to unleash their fury.
meanings.sent5: The old man shook his cane irascibly at the noisy kids playing outside.

meanings.definition: Showing a tendency to become angry easily.
meanings.sent1: The irascibly boss yelled at his employees for the smallest mistakes.
meanings.sent2: She avoided the irascibly customer who always complained about everything.
meanings.sent3: The irascibly toddler threw a tantrum when he couldn't have another cookie.
meanings.sent4: The irascibly sea seemed to roar with anger during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The irascibly dog barked fiercely at anyone who approached its territory.
